name: Hotel Cruise

reviews.text: We chose the Hotel Cruise because we were driving around Italy. It's just off the Autostrada and has all the modern conveniences without costing a fortune. We booked a Junior suite which gave us quite a bit of room, but still three beds in one room. It was reasonably priced. The only gripe I had was that the English speaking Sat TV Channels were blocked. We called room service and they sent somebody, but they said you just have to flick through the channels. I wouldn't have minded this, but they had cards in the room saying which channels were English speaking. Breakfast is included, and is the usual self service deal with hot foods (eggs bacon and sausage) and cold.
reviews.title: Clean Modern Hotel - Easy access to shops and Switzerland

reviews.text: There is a shopping centre a short walk from the hotel. Apart from a very large supermarket (Self checkouts in English), It has a few basic restaurants in the top floor and there is discount fashion shops, a Chinese Restaurant and a Sports Shop in the complex. There is also a shop which my wife described as "Shoe heaven". It would take several days to see all the different shoes.
reviews.title: important info before you go

reviews.text: It's actually quicker to drive to Switzerland than to downtown Como, which is 5km (and 20 minutes) away. Traffic is usually busy. You can just drive through to Switzerland. Nobody asked for any passports. If you're cruising on Lake Como, you can either drive to the ferry and park (Underground parking cost us 16 Euros for the day) or take the train. The rail station is nearby.
reviews.title: Artfully Done

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Cruise many times and have always rated this hotel very highly for its good value, clean-large rooms, and free internet. This has not changed and it still does very well in those areas. However I just spent six nights and noticed that the air conditioning was not working, when I inquired at the front desk I was told "there is no air conditioning during this period" (read as during this time of year). A hotel of this level that caters to tourists and business travelers cannot withold air conditioning. The room was often hot and uncomfortable which leads me to think that in the future I will not stay at the Cruise without confirming there will be air conditioning available.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: Stayed here for one day on Business Trip to Switzerland.Nearest Airport is either Milan Linate or Malpensa which are like 1.5 Hours by Taxi.Arrived in the Night and left in the morning but for Dinner took a taxi into Como which has a great but small Indian restaurant called Namaste.Their Chicken Tandoori is out of the world.
reviews.title: Efficient and Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we very much enjoyed our stay in this hotel. the room and bathroom were spacious and well fitted out. When I got sick the staff were very kind and helpfull. Good breakfast buffet with a lot of fresh fruit. Good and central location near the main toll roads. You do need a car though if you want to go to the city of Como.
reviews.title: Excellent price/quality ratio

reviews.text: My family stayed here one night on our way to board a cruise ship in Genoa. The room had adequate space for our needs but rather than pay an extra 30 euro per night for a baby bed, we made our toddler a pallet on the floor and she loved it. So my only complaint is the high charge for a toddler bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was included in our rate and offered a normal selection of foods. They advertise this to be an American style breakfast but it screamed european to me. It was deli meats, cheeses, pastries, bacon that was undercooked, yogurt and a selection of cereals. It was fine for us as we are not huge eaters.
reviews.title: Great hotel near como

reviews.text: Internet (wifi) is included in each room...we were unsure after reading the reviews.
reviews.title: I use to stop there after a long drive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were clean and we would definitely stay here again if passing through Italy again. There is a mall that is hidden behind the hotel that offers lots of shopping, a grocery store and several eateries. I am glad we stumbled upon it bc it was the perfect place to grab a slice of pizza, gelato and some toiletries we forgot to pack for the cruise.
reviews.title: very nice travel stop

reviews.text: We spent three days at Hotel Cruise. We had to stay an extra 2 days because of a snow storm in New York. No problem. Food was good. Breakfast came with the room and it was great.
reviews.title: great hotel

The hotel is situated in a suberb of Como and is reachable mainly by car. If you do not intend to rent a car, choose another hotel to stay in..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Agree with others, the hotel is clean and easy to get to from the motor way. Easy drive up the hill to Bellagio. Breakfast the very good, large selection and high quality. Large grocery store is a short walk away. Easy on property parking.
reviews.title: Lovely spacious room, near a beautiful lake

description: Hotel Cruise is a four star superior design business & congress hotel situated at a 15 minute drive from Lake Como, in the immediate vicinity of the A9 Como Sud highway exit, midway between Milan and Lugano (Switzerland) and at a short drive from Malpensa airport. This hotel is ideal for business travellers or leisure guests travelling by car and looking for a modern and comfortable location in Como. The hotel’s 218 rooms are spacious and well appointed with independently controlled air conditioning and heating, mini-bar, safe, Pay TV and high speed internet connection.
